sentence.Network_en: She has become a lot more tolerant and communicative.
sentence.Network_cn: 她变得宽容多了，也爱说话了。

sentence.Network_en: I don't find him very communicative.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin communicativus, from communicat- 'shared', from the verb communicare (see communicate)

entry.def: Someone who is communicative talks to people, for example about their feelings, and tells people things.

example.ex: She has become a lot more tolerant and communicative.
example.tran: 她变得宽容多了，也爱说话了。

entry.tran: 交际能力的;表达能力的
entry.def: Communicative means relating to the ability to communicate.

example.ex: We have a very communicative approach to teaching languages.
example.tran: 我们在语言教学中非常强调交际教学法。

sentences.sentence: "was a communicative person and quickly told all she knew"- W.M.Thackeray

auth_sentence.content: An evil so communicative that it doth...work like poison.

auth_sentence.content: So in a way our universe is digital and communicative.

sentences.en: He has a headache and isn’t feeling communicative today.
Shopping-bag ladies are not very communicative and take general conversation as an intrusion.
sentences.cn: 携购物袋的女士们不大爱说话,她们把一般的交谈视为打扰。
